message_1:
If P represents "It's sunny today" and Q represents "I will go for a picnic", represent the following statement using propositional logic: "I will go for a picnic if it's sunny today and I have no work to do."

Then, determine if the following compound proposition is true or false: "If it's sunny today and I don't have work to do, then I will go for a picnic."
message_2:
Let R represent "I have no work to do." The given statement can be represented using propositional logic as follows:

(P ∧ R) → Q

As for the truth value of the compound proposition, we cannot determine if it is true or false without knowing the truth values of P, Q, and R. The truth value of the compound proposition depends on the specific situation and the truth values of the individual propositions.
